Name: Establishing a maximum number of for-hire vehicles affiliated with each base.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a maximum number of for-hire vehicles affiliated with each base

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on For-Hire Vehicles
This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Filed (End of Session)

Summary: This bill would create a cap of 1,000 licensed for-hire vehicles that may be affiliated with each base in the City.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision e of section 19-511 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
      e. A licensed base station or black car base shall at all times have no fewer than ten affiliated vehicles or black cars and no more than 1,000 affiliated vehicles or black cars, except that a base station for which a license was first issued prior to January 1, 1988 and which at that time had fewer than ten affiliated vehicles or a base station which has an affiliation with a wheelchair accessible vehicle may have as few as five affiliated vehicles, not including black cars and luxury limousines.
      ï¿½ 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law. The commission shall take any actions necessary for its implementation, including the promulgation of rules, prior to such effective date.
      






JJD
LS 1944
4/4/18
